bea1: ^Oh dear, being nocturnal is [slant]not[/] fun with a day job...
^[wave]O-Oh my[/]!  A new face!  What a nice surprise!
^I'm [c_beatrice]Beatrice[/], the town librarian.  It's nice to meet you!
^I'm [c_pepper]Pepper[/c], the new mailman.  It's nice to meet you too!
^Ooooh, a mailman!  How nice!  We haven't had one of those in a while!
^We used to have Bill, but he retired a while back.
^We've been having to go to the post office to pick up mail ourselves for months!
^A good way to get your steps in, that's for sure!
^But this old bat's had enough, let me tell ya!
^Anyways, sorry for rambling at you.  Can I help you?
^Yes, actually I have a package for you.
^Oh, silly me, of course that's why you're here!  Thank you, dear![remove_item,Bea1]
^If you ever need help finding your way around, I'm your gal!
^But while you're still here, could I ask you a favor, dear?
^Sure, what can I help you with?
^You see... I have a friend on the edge of town.  Her name is [c_suzannah]Suzannah[/].
^She's what most would call a hermit.
^She wasn't always that way... but now she barely comes to town, if ever.
^I haven't gotten to check on her in a while.  Could you take this letter to her? [give_item,Suz1,letter,Suzannah,Beatrice,A letter addressed in a curly script][door_set_knot,obj_suzannah_door,suz1]
^If you go to the right past this library, all the way past Shoreside Station on the far edge of town you'll come to a beach.
suz1: ^I already [shake]told[/] you [c_beatrice]Bea[/]; I don't want anything to do with your party!
^Oh... you're not... never mind, I'm sorry.
^Can't say I recognize that voice.  Who are you?
^I'm [c_pepper]Pepper[/], the new mailman.  I have a delivery for you.  It's a letter.
^She asked me to bring this to you.  She's worried about you.
^So she put you up to this?  Then tell her I don't need her concern.
^Thank you for bringing me this. Now off you go, back to [c_beatrice]Bea[/]. And try not to trip on the rocks. [door_set_knot,obj_beatrice_door,bea2]
bea2: ^Oh, you're back!  And now that it's later in the day I'm simply [wheel]brimming[/] with energy!  [wave]Woo hoo[/]!
^I'm okay, I appreciate your concern though.
^Did you manage to get the note to [c_suzannah]Suzannah[/]?
^Yeah, but she wasn't too pleased to read who the note was from.
^Well, dear, every year I like to throw a little party for everyone in town.
^Or I used to, anyway, back when people would show up
^Everyone brought all kinds of goodies, there'd be games, music, and all manner of festivities!
^Now I can't seem to get anyone to bother coming.
^As a mailman, I'll get around town a lot.
^Maybe I could help you with that?
^I'd be happy to!  It's getting late for me though, good night!
^Good night [c_pepper]Pepper[/c], thank you so much for your help today!
cly1: ^The gnomes!  They've escaped, and now Port Pleasant will feel their wrath!
^Wait, do you seriously not know about the gnomes?
^Well then my dear, today's your lucky day!  Allow me to enlighten you.
^I do have to get back to my deliv-
^Don't be silly!  Now, as I was saying...
^The gnomes are creatures who came to us long ago.  When?  Nobody knows!
^They're alive, I know it, but nobody believes me!
^They're known to be pranksters. They'll disappear in the blink of an eye...
^...then next thing you know, they're off pranking the poor townspeople!
^Well, it starts with generally messing with people and things in inconsequential ways.
^But if left unchecked for too long, they'll start getting more and more ambitious.
^This could lead to them trying to take over the world!
^So you travel around town every day, right?
^Sure I can!  You're gonna help me find the gnomes!
^Anyways, the name's [c_clyde]Clyde[/].  It's a pleasure, partner!
^I'm sure the first is out there as we speak, waiting for you to track it down!
^So... how do I know where to find these gnomes?
^Keep your eyes out for something in town that looks... off.
^Like something's been tampered with in a strange way.
^There, if you look hard enough, you'll find a gnome.
^So, once I find them, what should I do?
^As long as you can see them they won't move, so you can just grab it.
^I see.  Well, I'll keep my eye out for your... gnomes.
^Wonderful, thanks a million!  Take care now!
cly2: ^Ah, well if it isn't my dear partner!  How goes- [remove_item,cly2]
^Oh, look what you have here!  You've done it!  Thanks, partner!
^You seem perplexed.  Care to tell me wha-
^No, no, no, lawn ornaments are not supposed to BLINK at me!
^I've already explained to you what they are!  Oh, but you didn't believe me!
^[c_clyde]Clyde[/], I've been here for only a few days, why would I believe you??
^So you'll keep being my partner, right?
^At this point, I guess I'm committed...
^Can't believe I'm dealing with sentient gnomes my first day on the job!
pie1: ^Ah, you must be the new mailman!  [c_pepper]Pepper[/], was it?
^I'm [c_pierre]Pierre[/].  Welcome to Port Pleasant!  How was the move?
^It went well!  I'm excited to get to see more of the town.
^Glad to hear!  You'll be getting to do plenty of that soon enough.
^Anyways, let me give you the run down on what you'll be doing here.
^Each morning, you'll come in here and get your packages for the day.
^Seems like a light day today, so you shouldn't have too much trouble.
^Oh, this is for [c_beatrice]Beatrice![/]  You'll find her at the library.
^And this here is for [c_clyde]Clyde[/].  You'll find him at his house down the road, past the library.
^She's a sweetheart, if not a little... batty.  Heh.
^Now, for the delivery process.  When you arrive at a house, you'll knock on the door.
^[wave]"Remember, be patient, and greet each customer with a smile!"[/]
^Once they answer the door, you'll hand the package to them.
^Sometimes, townspeople will have things they'll want you to deliver to other people.
^You can feel free to take care of that while you're on the job.
^Anyways, I think that about covers it.  Simple enough?
^No problem.  Off you go now, good luck today!
^Actually, [c_pepper]Pepper[/], one last thing before you go
^Stop back here after you finish your deliveries tonight.  I want to hear about how it goes!
pie2: ^She had me take a letter to the beach for [c_suzannah]Suzannah[/] so I got to see whole town.
^Ah, is that so?  Haven't heard that name in a minute.
^Do you know why she's shut herself away like that, [c_pierre]Pierre[/]?
^Yes, but unfortunately that's not my information to disclose.  I'm sure you'll find out eventually.
^As stoic and abraisive as she can be sometimes, [c_suzannah]Suzannah[/]'s got a soft heart.
^Might just take you some time and effort to get through to her, y'know?
^Anyways, after that, I stopped back at the library to let [c_beatrice]Beatrice[/] know that I had delivered the letter.
^We talked a bit about this party she used to throw for the townspeople.
^I remember going to that once or twice.  It's a shame it fell through.
^Well, I offered to help her put it back together.
^After seeing how sad she was that the community drifted apart, I guess it just felt right to offer to help.
^I'm just not sure I'll be able to.  I barely know anyone!
^I guess I got ahead of myself.
^I've known you for all of one day, if that.  And I can already tell you have a good head on your shoulders.
^And, being a mailman, you tend to make your way around town.
^That way, you'll find yourself in the know with everything soon enough.
^I think that's a pretty good pathway to being able to help bring people back together.
^Besides, "Small acts of kindness" is pretty much in the job description.
^Of course.  Just take it one step at a time.  Good work today!
